page.title: 17OUR SURVEY IN CLAYPOLE
page.content: Our grid reference is 85,48 and our teacher helped us to find it on the map. We left school and walked down Doddington Lane. We noticed most of this part of the block was made up of buildings. We were asked to notice what was grown in the fields we were going to survey. Mr Clark, one of our local farmers met us to take us around his farm. He showed us the fields and talked to us about the crops. He showed us different kinds of corn and explained the difference between wheat and barley. Mr Clark has twelve fields most of which are arable. He also showed us two dykes and explained how they drained his land. We left the farm, after thanking Mr Clark for his time, but first noted what was in each field so we could complete the survey.
